page.title: 07CHANGES IN FENTON
page.content: Mrs Simon told us about an island down a track at the bottom of Pump Lane. The island is 100 years old. The horses used to drink out of the pond in the middle. Mrs Simon dug out the middle of the pond so that the ducks there could swim on it. The island used to belong to the house which was on the back straight of the track. The house,known as Fenton House, has been knocked down because it was old and dangerous. The land where it stood has been made into a field. There are the remains of an old air-field and it is about a mile in perimeter. The track has two blocks. The island is in the second block. There is a butcher's shop in a garage at the first bungalow on Pump Lane. It is the only shop in the village.
